definition: to halt/to stay/to be stationed (of troops, diplomats etc)
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: I suddenly remembered the two resident engineers' great trust.
sentences.chinese: 突然間想起了兩位駐地工程師的重託。

sentences.english: The whole island will also serve as a permanent station and rear-supply base for ASA troops.
sentences.chinese: 崇明全島同時是亞安軍各部隊的永久駐地和後勤基地。

sentences.english: That area also houses the Communist Party committee building, which was almost gutted, Li said.
sentences.chinese: 李說，那是機要地區，縣委駐地也在此處。

sentences.english: North Village resident township government, elevation 1806 meters.
sentences.chinese: 鄉政府駐地北灘村，海拔1806米。

sentences.english: Home of the little girl water lotus also served as lobbyists.
sentences.chinese: 駐地的小姑娘水蓮還主動當起了說客。

sentences.english: Anyang Street, Ruian City People's Government of the resident Wansong East 154.
sentences.chinese: 瑞安市人民政府駐地安陽街道萬松東路154號。

sentences.english: Chen Decai was back to the station, Lin Jason let people don't wake him.
sentences.chinese: 陳德財被揹回駐地，林傑森讓人不要叫醒他。

sentences.english: In this post you may see interesting forts of the Brest fortress.
sentences.chinese: 在這個駐地，你可以看到有趣的佈列斯特要塞堡壘。

sentences.english: Alright , you may return to station.
sentences.chinese: 夢音好，你可以回到駐地了。

sentences.english: Area residents have a community of 21, more than 130 resident units.
sentences.chinese: 轄區內有社區居委會21個，駐地單位130餘個。

definition: stronghold/defended military base/base for operations/strategic point/foothold/(market) presence
to dispatch (sb) in an official capacity/to be posted (as an ambassador, foreign correspondent etc)
to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
